com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface manageItem

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageItem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageItem(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageItem API creates, modifies, or deletes items.

    • Method Detail

      • manageItem

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageItem(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageItem API creates, modifies, or deletes items. The default behavior of the manageItem API is to create a new item if the specified item does not exist, or modify the item if it does. This is the same as passing Action as Manage. Pass Create or Modify in the Action attribute to use a specific behavior. Additionally, Delete may be passed to delete an item.

        The API will also handle the scenario when items are added or removed from a classification that contain additional attributes, which are based on assigned ItemAttributes, the corresponding additional attributes will be added or removed from the items accordingly.

        If system property yfs.manageItem.EnableUpdateOfAdditionalAttribute is set to Y, this API is called to support backward compatibility for updating AdditionalAttribute record for the Item. This property must not be used where AdditionalAttribute records represent a value for ItemAttribute record.

        If child of an item with variations is created, the API automatically assigns it to the same category/classification as the parent.

        Note: If same item is being created by multiple threads simultaneously using manageItem API (like running catalog load scripts), the API may throw unique constraint violation exception.

        Assigning Values For Attributes

        This API will accept values for Attributes assigned to its category as additional attributes in the AdditionalAttribute element. The value of the Name field will be based on the AttributeID field of the corresponding Attribute record. The Value, DoubleValue and IntegerValue fields will be based on the actual allowed values of the assigned attribute. The API will perform validation to ensure that the assigned values are valid allowed values of the attribute.

        The Attributes configured as either derived attributes or reference attributes are not allowed to be assigned values at either the item level or the category level. The validation of the assigned value will be performed only if the flag IsAllowedValueDefined on the Attribute record is set to Y. Also, the Value attribute of the AdditionalAttribute record will be validated against AllowedValueLength attribute for a TEXT Attribute only if the IsAllowedValueDefined flag is not set to Y.

        Sub-catalog Organization Items

        The API will accept SubCatalogOrganization to create items that belong to a valid sub-catalog organization. When modifying or deleting an item using the API, the SubCatalogOrganization must match the SubCatalogOrganization of the existing records.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:
        com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMValidateItemCreationUE
        com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMValidateItemModificationUE

        Events Raised:

        These events are defined under the ITEM_DEFINITION transaction.

        AFTER_CREATE_ITEM:

          This event is raised after successful creation of the item.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: modify Item events XML
          Template Support: No

        AFTER_MODIFY_ITEM:

          This event is raised after successful modification of the item.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: modify Item events XML
          Template Support: No

        AFTER_DELETE_ITEM:

          This event is raised after successful deletion of the item.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: modify Item events XML
          Template Support: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
